In last 5 days I had a heartattack followed by a stroke at age 28. Also had some family events earlier. If you react within an hour or so you havw great chances of survival and not having long term problems. Also when you are younger your body does crazy stuff to help itself. In my case, brain found alternative paths to keep that part of brain alive before i was operated on. So while its shitty for us to have to constantly worry, there is hope aswell. These operations are minimally invasive and almost routine at this point. If you can recognize symptoms fast enough youll probably be fine. :)

I landed a new job and this Monday would have been my first day and was really happy. Got heart attack on Saturday evening followed by a stroke on Monday. At age 28. Now couple of months of rehab and shit. Thats life i guess :)

Its not just age, its inevitability of it that gives you somewhat of peace and calm. About 3 weeks ago I had a heart attack followed by a stroke at 28yo, and lying there in intensive care not knowing what will happen made me sad for my family, but you make peace with yourself. Its not the same I know, but dying there was still an option I had to think about.

Im glad to see your are still here and kicking :) but yeah, I felt so bad for my parents and gf. I remember an interview I read with some dude that defused explosives where they asked him how he handles stress and he just replied "what stress? It either goes well or its not my problem anymore." Tried to keep that perspective for me, but felt really sad for my family. But hey, we are still here!
Thanks for those kind words! Got out couple of days ago, going slow but going. One day at a time!
Thank you, means alot to hear kind words like that! Im gonna be okay, just going to take a while to mend back completely. And keep yourself healthy because this sucks so much ass.
Thanks, Ill def check it out since finding various tasty to food to eat right now is kinda hard sadly

I still dont know what was the trigger, waiting on results for some genetics tests and trombophilia. I do know that clot from my heart separated and went to the brain and that gave me a stroke, so that was just shitty luck. What I do know is that I worked like 60-70 hour weeks, ate shit and worked out once a week. But alot of people live like that and dont have heart attack at 28. Definetly try to make a habit of eating veggies and fruit alot and try atleast like walk 30min each day, and if you are a smoker just quit. Its not worth it.

Doctors dont know yet what was cause of heart attack. Clot from heart separated and went to brain and that gave me a stroke, so that was some shitty luck. But Im still waiting on some test results that I hope will give us more info.
Thank you for those kind wishes :) improving slowly!
Im sorry to hear that and I hope you manage to recover, but Im glad you can have some comfort and make something out of a shitty situation

Not really, I was at home watching TV with gf, went to the kitchen to get water and chest just started hurting like hell, called ambulance within 10sec since the pain wasnt something i was familiar with
I was in hospital and just stopped making sense mid conversation and left side of my face started falling down.

That was much scarier to me because I lost ability to think and act, wasnt aware of things even though I was awake. Thankfully there were other people around. With heart attack it just hurt as hell. And thnx :)

I wouldnt say heavy smoker, smoked less than a pack a day, and I drink rarely, once in a month or so. But I get drunk of 5 beers, so I wouldnt call that heavy drinking either, atleast where I live. I did drink and smoke much more when I was younger (highschool and college) and you could add in weed then. Im not fat, healthy bmi (im like 2m tall and around 95kg).

We have only McD here but a lot of deliveries, deep fried stuff, grilled food and other unhealthy stuff, like 8 cups of coffee a day, and rarely veggies and fruit. Also, I ate like once a day and thats mostly in the evening.

WRITING.TITLE: How do you play this game solo?
WRITING.TEXT: I started playing Division 1 couple of years ago with some friends and we had a blast. But after a while they turned to other games so I tried to play solo. And it was a pretty boring/bad experience. Last week we tried division 2 over uplay+ and had a blast but i see already that this wont last (we all work, some have kids etc). I really like the game but playing solo feels lackluster. Is there something to improve solo experience? Or how hard is it to find a decent group that speaks english? Im sorry if this question goes against rules or something, couldn't find like a daily question thread or similar.
